results.title: Food (for) thought
results.creator_credit: Daniel Crooks, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Food. Religion. Television. Using a multiplicity of styles, this technically accomplished animation seeks to present a critique of religion and consumer culture. It makes an impressive idiosyncratic statement, with stylistic references to Jan Svankmajer and the Brothers Quay.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daniel Crooks, Dennis Tupicoff and Victorian College of the Arts

results.title: Fond memories of Cuba [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: David Bradbury, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Frontline Films
results.brief_description: In this film about life in modern Cuba, documentary filmmaker David Bradbury travels across the country attempting to answer the question of whether Cuba has succeeded as a socialist society, forty years after Fidel Castro’s rise to power. “Fond memories of Cuba” is a telling testament to the daily struggle for survival for the inhabitants of Cuba, many of who lament their lot in life. The film depicts a decayed country that thrives on music and culture but is incapacitated financially and crippled by the US embargo. Despite many positive reviews, Bradbury was critiqued for imposing onto this project his disillusionment with Cuba and pre-ordained notion of a society in peril, which he then sought to confirm via this work. Essentially a collection of interviews, “Fond memories of Cuba” also features many street scenes including arrests that depict police brutality. This work is interspersed with archival footage of the 1960s revolution and pre-revolution political situation, which includes discussion of the role of Che Guevara during those times. As well as a document that teases out questions of politics and society, the film also serves as a fascinating travelogue of the country’s natural beauty and enduring culture. In English and Spanish with English subtitles.

constellations_primary.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_primary.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

results.title: Focus on France
results.brief_description: Since the end of World War II, the French have been attempting to improve farming methods in their country as part of an overall plan to increase prosperity. This film reviews progress in this direction taking, as an example, a farming community in the Chateau country of the Loire.

results.title: Focus on fat
results.brief_description: A survey of the vital part played by fat in the production of food. Includes whale oil, vegetable oil from coconuts in Ceylon, and palm oil from West Africa.

results.title: Focus on Canberra
results.brief_description: Shows the picturesque quality of Canberra and the quiet beauty of the environment in which the nerve centre of Australia’s Federal Government is situated. Musical soundtrack, no spoken commentary.

results.title: Flying careers with the Navy
results.brief_description: Illustrates aspects of the training of pilots for the Royal Australian Navy, showing how recruits gain experience handling Tiger Moth, Wirraway, Sea Fury and Fire-Fly types of aircraft. The film records joint Navy and Air Force exercises held off the NSW coast to test Australian defences against possible attack from sea and air.

results.title: Flying among the weeds
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description: This video examines the risks of low flying by Australian army pilots, men trained to use the agility and mobility of frail, light aircraft on a battle field to help groundforces fight and win a battle. These men fly Bell 206B helicopters and Pelartus Porter and Nomad fixed wing planes.
